intro: Jacea antennata, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Jacea antennata is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
